main event: Three glowing, self-luminous objects were observed near St. Peters, Illinois on November 2, 1963.
interesting points: The objects appeared to be descending and gave off fluctuating lights of variable intensity.
The objects were observed on ground radar by an airline pilot and co-pilot.
The sighting lasted for approximately 15 minutes.
The objects did not exhibit the characteristics of a meteor, satellite, or conventional aircraft.
Similar sightings of glowing objects had been reported in the area previously.
